Hi

the book was writen by Charles Gruzanski. He is dead
now but his son Robert has all of his material amd set
up this site http://www.robertg.com/

the book was based on masaki ryu and had a lot  in it
about Nawa Fumio who is still alive (in his 90's) and
only recently retired from teaching. He will be the
last soke of his ryu as he has split it into 4 shihan
lines. At leas 2 photos in the book feature Hatsumi
masaaki who left the ryu and later gained fame as a
ninja dude - Bujinkan Dojo.

Dont worry about being a wanna be ninja - it got the
bets of us hooked at one time or another

the spikes and the stars are all known as shuriken.

the spikes are better know as Bo-shuriken

Havent we discussed Shuriken etc in the recent past -
maybe worth looking at the archive onthe yahoo site.

Paul





--- Silk Road School <silk.road.school@...>
wrote:


---------------------------------
According to the one book I've ever seen that
discusses the matter in any
detail - _Spike and Chain_  (covering manriki-kusari,
shuriken and shaken) -
"shuriken" refers only to the spike, dart and knife
types of throwing
weapon - basically, those which are only bilaterally
symmetrical.
The radially symmetrical ones - discs, stars,
triangles, squares- are
properly termed "shaken".  The book was out in the
early '70s, before the
cresting of the wave of ninja silliness, and it
appeared to be fairly
solidly researched.  I shed my copy back in '75, so I
can't cite the
author's name.
Nate, don't go thinking I'm one of your "resident
ninja masters" on account
of this, okay?
Gereg

Message: 2
   Date: Wed, 11 Aug 2004 15:50:08 -0700 (PDT)
   From: Nate Ledbetter <ltdomer98@...>
Subject: Re: caltrops and steel bars


--- Edward Alexander <edyhiphop@...> wrote:

> Sorry for saying a stupid question but what are
> caltrops?????And what are those small discs with
> very sharp edges?????(how are they called)
>
> Edy

Caltrops are spikes placed/strewn on the ground to
impede/distract a pursuer, etc. The general shape of
"tetsubishi" ("iron diamonds") is a 4 pointed object
with the points such that if you throw them down,
there is always one point up and 3 points as a base.
Think of jacks, from the kids game, except sharper.

The small discs with the sharp edges you refer to are
shuriken. There's several names according to the
shape, etc., and I'm sure one of our resident ninja
masters will pipe up and tell us, but I'm not sure
what all they are. I know under the heading of
"shuriken", you've got all sorts of shapes and sizes
of throwing knives, including the disc and star shaped
types.
